lexUnit.name: intercept.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: obstruct and prevent from continuing to a destination

sentence.text: Police intercepted the call and raided the address .
But the son intercepted the letter and persuaded them to sign .
The Nazis intercepted the letter and he was obliged to resign from the Reichsmusikkammer .
It was in Alistair 's mind that he might locate and intercept his own letter .
` We intercepted a message sent from a business firm in Paris to The Hague . "
Royal Marines intercepted the vessel which was found to be carrying cargo which is banned under the United Nations measures .
The Royal Navy intercepted his yacht and he was accused of killing his parents in Jersey .
A man intercepted him and began to say something .
Only before we could get a team out to intercept them she disappeared . "
` Excuse me , my dear , " he said in a clipped accent as he intercepted her by the front door .
Two sentries stepped to intercept them , drawing back when they saw who it was .
One morning , Azmaveth came running down the corridor outside Lucien 's room to intercept him before he went to his practice .
Three hundred Catholic miners marched in from Cleator Moor , four miles away , intercepted him outside the meeting-hall , beat him as hard as they could , and left him for dead .
In Manchester he was intercepted by PC Nicholas Cock , who was shot and killed .
And at Lady Wood , near Brigstock in Northamptonshire , the deserters were intercepted by the dragoons , to whom they surrendered without resistance .
During the afternoon a single reconnaissance Ju88 was intercepted by four Hurricanes flown by Plt.Off .
On the previous day , Nov. 24 , five Arab gunmen attempted a seaborne attack from Lebanon , but were all shot dead when their vessel was intercepted by an Israeli naval patrol vessel .
English reinforcements approaching along the edge of the Carse were intercepted by the Earl of Moray and driven off in disorder , leaving heavy casualties .
Typewritten , it was intercepted by police a week after the killings and ` came from the murderer beyond a question of doubt " .
In Europe last summer , France banned all imports of domestic waste after intercepting German trucks carrying hospital waste , sometimes hidden in ordinary household rubbish .
Imagine the uproar if these drift-netters had been intercepting salmon going to France or Germany .
` Would this request from London have anything to do with the package and report I sent them , which never arrived because it was intercepted right here in this office ? "
` In some instances it has been sheer luck for members of the public with either guns jamming or security force patrols intercepting the terrorists . "
The Phalangist Radio Free Lebanon reported that the clashes started when an SLA patrol intercepted a Lebanese army unit removing mines on the outskirts of Mlikh township .
An Italian naval vessel intercepted the boat and escorted it to Brindisi .
Police intercepted the Peugeot and chased it into the lower Shankill , where the gunmen jumped out .
She intercepted Dieter just as he was emerging on to the terrace .
Second , it intercepts every communication it can , from friend or foe , and tries to decrypt it .
Dave Forbes was waiting and swiftly intercepted D'Arcy before he could meet up again with Roy Bliss .
They were running a great risk of being intercepted and possibly destroyed , unless they knew what we are bound to suspect : that the English leadership was incompetent , and perhaps divided .
The call was intercepted and the Princess of Wales spent the rest of the cruise away from her husband , chosing to eat all her meals with Princes William and Harry instead of the other adults .
He was intercepted on 2 December .
The militants had been intercepted in the Tithwal sector whilst crossing the Line of Actual Control from Azad Kashmir ( the Pakistan-controlled sector ) into India .
This week a consignment of langoustines , scallop meat and monk fish for Germany was intercepted at Boulogne by French fishermen protesting at cheap imports .
Meanwhile Ben had gone off to move another lighter and was then intercepted by the Manager who directed him to the dock some way off .
The items were intercepted in Haverhill by a sorting office worker .
